qas.question: What tribe did Ali belong to?
Along with being his cousin, what relationship did Ali have to Muhammad?
Where was the capital before Ali changed it?
Why did Ali meet with little resistance?
When did the Second Fitna occur?
Who was the wife of Marwan I?

context: After the assassination of Uthman in <a0_0><b5_0>656<b5_0/><a0_0/>, Ali, a member of the <a1_0>Quraysh<a1_0/> tribe and the cousin and <a2_0>son-in-law<a2_0/> of Muhammad, was elected as the caliph. He soon met with resistance from several factions, owing to his relative <b6_0>political inexperience<b6_0/>. Ali moved his capital from <a3_0>Medina<a3_0/> to Kufa. The resulting conflict, which lasted from <b7_0>656 until 661<b7_0/>, is known as the First Fitna ("<a4_0>civil war<a4_0/>"). Muawiyah I, the governor of Syria, a relative of Uthman ibn al-Affan and Marwan I, wanted the culprits arrested. Marwan I manipulated everyone and created conflict. <b8_0>Aisha<b8_0/>, the wife of Muhammad, and Talhah and Al-Zubayr, two of the companions of Muhammad, went to Basra to tell Ali to arrest the culprits who murdered Uthman. <b9_0>Marwan I<b9_0/> and other people who wanted conflict manipulated everyone to fight. The two sides clashed at the Battle of the Camel in 656, where Ali won a decisive victory.
